Text.content:
There are three sample React applications available that give application developers a quick introduction to how the JSON API works.

  • Demo 1 is the hello world of the JSON API. It introduces to how content can be retrieved by means of virtual file system URLs.
  • Demo 2 explains how lists can be retrieved and how list options can be overwritten dynamically.
  • Demo 3 illustrates how content with individual element settings can be read and displayed.

The demos in no way represent a real-world use case. They are kept as short and simple examples to introduce to the API. The React source code is available online. It contains useful comments about technical details. Additionally, there is an API documentation available that explains the features of the JSON API in detail.
